website_summaries.verdict: The right triangle shape fits neatly against buildings and works well with other shade sails.
pros: Knitted polyethylene blocks 90% to 95% of harmful UV rays
This shade is well constructed and has steel rings that hooks attach to easily
This shade comes in two sizes up to almost 23 feet

customer_reviews.title: Consider ourselves experts
customer_reviews.text: We have strung shade screens for years - here in the Southwest. This is an excellent product. Much higher quality than the shades I bought at Costco several years ago. The screen material is heavier weight. That produces more shade against the sun. The hardware and stitching are heavy duty. We see little chance the material will stretch like other shades we have used. Excellent instructions along with cautions on how not to attach, etc. Heavy duty hardware included, if needed. We purchased both triangle and rectangle shades, and overlaid them to fit our specific dimensions. So glad we found this product!
customer_reviews.author: LSS

customer_reviews.title: I like the look
customer_reviews.text: I like the look, the added shade for the patio and the quality thus far seems to stand up to the elements. Disappointed that the size indicated is not quite the finish size of each of the sails. 16.5x16.5.22'11 finish product is 15'9" X 15'9" X 21'8" I wouldn't trust the nylon rope provided so I went to home depot and purchased stainless steel cable. I'd purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Ron L

customer_reviews.title: the color is beautiful, and (2) 68 & 69 y
customer_reviews.text: Everything was in the box, the color is beautiful, and (2) 68 & 69 y.o. women hung it. You just have to decide where to put it and what to attach it to. Might need some extra cord---we did.
customer_reviews.author: Charnisay L. Dauer

customer_reviews.title: Much needed shade without blocking all light! Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this sun shade sail, I wasn't sure it would be the correct size, however, it was perfect. Not wanting to spend a lot of money for shade over my deck, and not exactly sure what and where shade would be best, I chose the shade sail because I can move it to where I want it without having to remove a structure. I sprayed it with scotch guard to make sure it was water repellent. It has been up 2 weeks now it not only adds shade without blocking all the light, but it also adds a fabulous color.
customer_reviews.author: Panders

customer_reviews.title: I need to learn geometry over again if this is a right triangle
customer_reviews.text: I should have looked at the picture now instead of focusing on the description. I'm no math scholar but I know what a right triangle is... And this is not one. The points are skinny and the sides curve in so you lose a couple of feet of the fabric coverage on each side. It's like a thong instead of briefs. Plus the sides don't get tight. They are flopped down because of the weird shape. Wouldn't buy again. Would return if I had enough energy left after installing this in Texas heat.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great shade for the money -- way better than a poled canopy
customer_reviews.text: The large shades are great, a good deal for the money. I also bought the 12x12x12, and this one was good, but is not as versatile as the big one IMO. The small one did come with hardware, which was nice, but this large one covers such a nice chunk of patio that it's worth it. Easy to set up (even easier if you have some rigging experience) and strong. I use long rope and poles to make it fit exactly perfectly over my outdoor back patio area. These things are awesome...
customer_reviews.author: nicorellius

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this shade!!!!!!!!I have it attached to the house at 2 points, then out to a tree in order to cover my deck. It is quite Perfect! It not only gives some nice shade to the deck, it shades the afternoon sun from beating in to my back sliding doors. Win, Win! I live in Florida and the afternoon sun made using my back deck too hot. What I really love about this, is it's not solid canvas, you still get a little twinkle through the material. I bought the blue so it just meshes with the sky. Really a nice quality product.
customer_reviews.author: ROBIN L PIPER

customer_reviews.title: Works well for two non-standard use cases
customer_reviews.text: The original intent of the sun shade was for blocking some of the afternoon sun that bakes one side of our non-insulated Northern California house. It serves its purpose there. The unintended use case was: after replacing a 60-year-old fence between our house and our neighbor's house, we lost a privacy barrier for facing windows that had been provided by the vegetation that had grown around the old fence. So, the sun shade is a perfect privacy screen. The distance between the supporting center 2x4's on the fence and the supporting facia board is a bit short, so there's some vertical slack. But this does not seem to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: SJC

customer_reviews.title: Looks good!
customer_reviews.text: I love the color, and it's as advertised. I know either the seller or reviews mentioned that the ends taper, and since that is true, I could probably go up a size. I am using it more for privacy than shade. It looks good, and has withstood wind with no issues. I installed it with screw eyes, made loops in the provided ropes, then used wire ties to connect ropes to screw eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Pam F

customer_reviews.title: Simple, elegant, effective
customer_reviews.text: I had two regular triangle sails in the backyard over the pool and decking for a year. This year I just added another this one is straight on the long edge and spans across from the patio to the rv garage, over the deep end. It's an app nexpensive way to get more spots out of direct sun. I live in Phoenix, it is sunny all year. The two I got last year don't show any signs of sun damage, the UV protection on them seems to work.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Anytime Fitness
customer_reviews.text: Our area was almost 20 feet wide, so these worked out pretty well. Would have been better if they were 18ft wide instead of the 16ft, but to order custom sizes would have cost hundreds of dollars. So we saved and get a lot of compliments! I’d order the wire, because the rope wears out fast in a Windy City.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Buy the extra mounting hardware kit!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product about a month ago and extremely please with it. It is very easy to install (about 30 mins) lightweight and the material is very breathable, allowing rain to pass through so water does not weigh it down. It has been through several storms already and has not sagged or bowed in any way. I purchased and extra set of mounting hardware so that at one end of the triangle there a mounting points at various heights. This allows me to adjust the shade as the angle of the sun changes throughout the day. For the additional expense ($17.99), I highly recommend this add on as it dramatically increases the shades functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Love my sun shade! Totally worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was going to be bigger but I love it! It is totally worth every penny and I may just get another one for the other side of the pool. I love my sun shade!! It is made very well and it’s already held up on a couple Phoenix wind/dust storms. Definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: jessmom3

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a sturdy shade and the material feels like it should hold up well. I really needed a right angled shade to attach to the roof line and this was perfect for my application. It has been up for about 3 weeks now with winds topping around 20MPH [northern NV] and seems to be holding up well. Note the supplied rope does tend to stretch initially but after adjusting once it now seems to be fine. I am happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Woodhouse

customer_reviews.title: Looked well made and very colorful!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the look but didn’t even get out of package. We live in condo and the board keeps playing games with us regarding our deck which they knowingly damaged but refuse to repair. I’m Getting estimates for me to pay to have done, but until the board corrects the problem not doing anything. Was afraid to hold up returning sails because did not want to not be able to. But, the 3 sails I bought looked beautiful and I hope I can reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Nice look!
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price! Dont expect a cloth like material. Its more like a plastic burlap but dont let that stop you from getting this. They look great up. My suggestion is not to use the ropes they come with. I went to lowes and got thin cables and crimpped it to a loop and used beaner clips so I can take them down when needed. I dont know how they will hold up in the sun over time.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Tried LyShade.... Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Aloha! I really wanted to create a little dining area outside my little cottage, without killing the grass! A triangle shaped tarp/sunshade would be perfect without looking too shabby. So I had a vision, took a chance and bought LyShade! I hung it from two palm trees to my house, at a slight angle, where the grass still gets morning sun and a little light rain blows in. It's been perfect! Better and easier to put up than I thought it would be. Not only for cottages tho, but fancier homes as well. Thanks! Mary
customer_reviews.author: Mary L.

customer_reviews.title: Durable sun sail!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love our sun sail. It is nice, durable material and I like the nice green color. It is cut in pretty good and you can see in the picture what it covers on our 12x12 structure. It doesn’t cover what I thought but it covers enough.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with the construction of the sail
customer_reviews.text: Although I cant speak for longevity, I am happy with the construction of the sail. I have installed it over our pool primarily for protection from the sun while swimming, but Im hopeful it will help slow the chlorine breakdown as well. I have installed it extremely tightly with cables and it has held up over the past couple of weeks after two major thunderstorms. I will be ordering a second one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these... I love the fact the one side is longer and straight I have not put up the shades, yet. Its been too dang hot out...lol.. Beautiful color Nice protective packaging I know these will fit the bill...☺
customer_reviews.author: Diane Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We bought the shade to allow us to utilize our 90 degree patio deck and reduce cooling costs as the sun shines directly into a full glass slider without a shade. I believe the inside room is cooler and we are able to use the deck without roasting. I purchased shorter tightening bolts and should have purchased the longest available. The sail requires a lot of tension to position it and strength to pull it tight. Older folks may need someone younger and stronger or the ability with longer bolts to tighten while still attached. Very glad I purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware, this is the size of a slice of cheese...
customer_reviews.text: Holy Tamolies...this was stupid small. I was looking for something to really enclose a space in the backyard and make it feel as if it was an environment. This would barely work as a rooflet over my back door. SUPER small and even smaller seeming because it's a long skinny triangle. It was beautifully made, just wish it were 3 or 4 times the size. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: lyndairene

customer_reviews.title: This is not a true right triangle
customer_reviews.text: The product is not a right triangle. I expected it to have one corner fit snuggly in the corner of my deck but the side curve in so there is a gap between the wall and the shade letting the harmful sun in on both sides. I ended up having to use a rectangle shade to keep the sun out. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A. Veldkamp

customer_reviews.title: Seems well worth $40
customer_reviews.text: It lets water drain through which is great. The stitching and connecting loops are sturdy. Consider putting on gate hooks or carabiners for ease of taking down in wind. I might actually buy a few more.
customer_reviews.author: A.Pilek

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with our new Lyshade sail shade
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with our new Lyshade sail shade. It looks great and was simple to install. Looks even better when there is a breeze and the sail floats up and down gently. We are going to get another one for adjacent area. Very strong fabric. Much stronger than I imagined it would be for the cost. What a deal!!!.... Phasing out the umbrellas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous sun screen
customer_reviews.text: Very practical and inexpensive way to create shade. We used to sails over our lower deck. The tricky part is testing the area as the earth moves to get the shade at the sunniest part of the day.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shelby Churchill

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Shade
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this shade and another for my backyard, and they have transformed it in to a place I want to send time in. The shade material is high quality and durable too. I was worried as I live in a very windy area, but the shades are holding up nicely in in gusty wind conditions. I am very satisfied with this product. If i had a bigger yard, I would order more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted two years
customer_reviews.text: I got two years (of half-year-round) use out of this shade before it started to get a hole. Not bad; it gets a lot of wind and is in partial sun, and the squirrels sometimes use it as a trampoline. (Kidding, but they do run on it.) The blue color is rather subdued; its a dull gray-blue. I'm buying a different brand this time to get a brighter color. (TANG Sun Shades Depot Turquoise 16'x16'x23'). I says it has a three year warranty; I guess I'll save the information in case this one, too, only lasts two years! (Probably void if squirrels have played on it.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shade
customer_reviews.text: I picked this shade for the size and shape to pair it with a square shade I already had up that needed just a little help where morning and evening sun came around. I bought two and they were exactly what we needed. Nice color, easy to install and appears to be durable although we haven't had any strong winds or rain since it was put up.
customer_reviews.author: Windy

customer_reviews.title: Shade over the pool
customer_reviews.text: First off, it is an amazing color! It was easy to put up and adds a nice amount of color to our lanai! We have had it up for two months now, and in the heat of the Florida summer, it has added the perfect amount of shade over the lanai.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen A. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy sun sails
customer_reviews.text: These were a little complicated at first. I had to rearrange them a few times. Finally got them how I like and it was fairly easy then. I used two right angles, one is "upside down, hem side down" but it works. The center is an elliptical triangle. I ordered the 6 inch turnbuckles and D hooks set and then bought some chain from my local hardware store. I do wish my husband would have listened to me on the wood post...make sure to set it at an angle! "Slant it backwards" mine is already pulling towards the sails. Sad! All in all though, I do love these sails and hope they last for quite awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsay

customer_reviews.title: Works!!
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully. Installed in under 20mins. This opens up room by the front door to entertain guests without being sun scorched. The window facing the shade is significantly cooler too.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shade Sail
customer_reviews.text: We installed this sail over our pool to provide some much needed afternoon shade. We live in Arizona, where the summer sun is relentless, so this was a lifesaver. It installed easily, has been through some surprisingly gusty wind and some rain, and still looks great. We do take it down during the monsoon's high winds and heavy rains, but it has withstood a couple of 45mph gusts. I would buy this again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Karoly

customer_reviews.title: Quality Sun Shade
customer_reviews.text: Sun shade was slightly darker than expected (Terracotta) based on the photo but actually better color for my patio. Purchased stainless steel anchors found on amazon, which made installation quite easy. I'm still adjust the position to best block the sun, which is easy to do with the additional rope provided. Quality looks great and is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Works great when mounted correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Challenging to mount and had to buy longer rope to attach to structures in the right spots for even tension. But now that it’s up it’s working great! Casts a nice shadow on my deck that gets blasted with sun in the evening.
customer_reviews.author: JDWest

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy!
customer_reviews.text: After several storms and one possible tornado that came through, the sale is still attached and in great condition! It provides our children’s play area with great shade. Where we have it it is hidden in the trees, so it has been very durable with Liam‘s and other debris falling upon it. Thank you for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Something Well Made....
customer_reviews.text: The shades arrived on time and in good condition. It was nice of the company to provide ropes however rope will stretch and 4’ pieces are not enough in most cases. I’ve always used chain and it works very well. Unlike rope, it doesn’t stretch so when you’re done, you are done! Turnbuckles are a must and a come along is a big help! Also, the red is more of a rust color. We love the Cadet blue.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Lightening fast shipping and just as Shown
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this Shade Sail to use with our Trolley Bus RV and it matches perfectly, and is exactly what we imagined. Light weight and easy to handle (As ours will have to go up and down as we travel). Hubby picked up hardware at Home Depot so that we can just hook it on and then use one pole for support. We will actually be ordering a 2nd one soon so we can overlap! Will share pics when we go camping with the sail set up!
customer_reviews.author: Sing and Ray

customer_reviews.title: the shape is more like a string bikini
customer_reviews.text: I got caught off guard in the actual shape of the product. while the measurements from D ring to D ring are as in the advertisement the actual shade is significantly less. Delivery was excellent, price was acceptable given the size. But it doesn't really provide much shade due to how the sides pull in. Some people may appreciate the bikini look, however I was looking for more area shaded.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Look great!
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit to get the right angles to eliminate the sag. The shades are great haven't had them up long enough to comment on durability or sturdiness. The rope is ok, but not sure it's sturdy enough to last so replacing with wire. Update... wind came through and landed a huge branch on my wind shade.... it survived w/o any issues. Definitely a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great sun shades!
customer_reviews.text: This sun shade is so perfect for our patio that we bought another one, a little larger and sort of overlapped them in a very cool looking arrangement! Really would recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these up on my back deck for two years! They still look great! I live in south Texas and did not expect them to hold up with the hot sun this long. I’m honestly surprised, but so happy with them. We originally wanted to build a pergola and use these temporarily, but we’ve loved them so much we haven’t even thought about a pergola anymore. We always get complements on them too.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Not the right size
customer_reviews.text: Considering the measurements it gives take 1 foot away on every side. That is what you get. It will do for now I guess. Wont take the time to return it and have to pay shipping fees and all that. Not worth it. Just know that I wont order another
customer_reviews.author: CDailey

customer_reviews.title: These are othing to write home about.
customer_reviews.text: I bought three, one was good, one was okay, and one was sewn and not cut so well. They do have to be installed for a while to stretch out. With the way the cuts are made, doesn't really leave much of the sail to provide shade. Not too impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works like other sun shade sails I've bought. Decent quality, but will have to see how long it holds up. I haven't been taking these down due to not being windy, but it would be nice if the manufacture can mark which side is the long side. It's rather annoying trying to measure before hooking up.
customer_reviews.author: Deteria

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a true aesthetic shade sail, this is not it.
customer_reviews.text: The material is very plastic/synthetic feeling, and it has a sheen to it. I was looking for more of a canvas material. This fabric is very light. Also the shape is not a true triangle and so the shaded area is not as great as I had hoped. Also, the instructions were very limited and so getting the sail to be taught is a trial and error approach.
customer_reviews.author: MP from NY

customer_reviews.title: Be certain this is the shape you want
customer_reviews.text: I think the seller does try to inform you about the specific shape of this sail, but I still thought it would work fine. Well this shape is pretty useless for my needs. I had to buy another one that is larger and rectangular. I'll keep this triangle in case I find a use for it some day, though. As for quality, it's what I expected; nothing bad to say. I've only had/used it for a short period, so I don't know how well it holds up over time
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fine quality shade, lacking hardware
customer_reviews.text: This shade is the size that was advertised, nice bright color, seems durable, doesn't feel flimsy. The only downside is it didn't come with hardware -- no metal rings or caribiners, just rope at the ends. Not a big deal, but expect a trip to the hardware store before you install it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh T. Nite

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to decide how to hang, up and down.
customer_reviews.text: We did not use the rope that came with the sails. we used cable so think the sail is floating. We used 8 ft. poles . The picture shows the 12 x 12 x 17 and (2) 12 x 12x12
customer_reviews.author: V. Lee Shambo

customer_reviews.title: Love the pop of color and shade.
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and the shade that this adds to our deck. Also created additional architectural interest. It helps to have a helpful to layout, determine where to place corners and install. It’s been a month and several rain storms and still looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Quality and nice price.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Dimensions were exact. Small nylon rope for attaching, I didn’t order the hardware kit. I’m going to use various length bungee cords to attach. The price was below others, and it is worth the money. The seller is an Amazon professional. Nice email asking about any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Davis

customer_reviews.title: Crazy size
customer_reviews.text: We got two, and haven't used one yet. They're really strange sizes, and the ropes are really short so when we tried to put it up at our campsite, the ropes didn't allow the room needed to get the shade up. Bummer. Looks sturdy and durable though, too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy M Eli

customer_reviews.title: triangles
customer_reviews.text: The shade is a beautiful color and a great material. Even though this triangle sounds like it would cover a good size area, it doesn’t. The triangle shape just doesn’t provide a large area of shade. But the craftsmanship of the shade is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie P.

customer_reviews.title: Quick shipping, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, holds up well so far in the wind and matches perfectly to the old lady paint color our new house is. Covers the koi pond nicely.
customer_reviews.author: YAReviews

customer_reviews.title: BAD STRAPPING ON SAILCLOTH FOR MOUNTING , DIDN'T  LAST 6 weeks .  -different strap material
customer_reviews.text: I have put several of these up for friends and myself, this particular Sailcloth I had problems with because the straps that ends are hooked to for mounting ripped out - I think inferior cloth straps fasting the stainless hardware hook .
customer_reviews.author: Coppersteve

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction. Hangs like a rag!
customer_reviews.text: Sags. Comparing to the others from different company, this is not worth the time and money.
customer_reviews.author: annette m chang

customer_reviews.title: Love our sunshade!
customer_reviews.text: Saw these sunshades while looking at umbrellas and decided to try it out. We purchased the largest triangle in the cadet blue and it was perfect! We are happy that we went with the sunshade over the umbrella as it was much less expensive and provides more coverage than an umbrella would have. The quality of the shade is good and was free of any defects. We haven't had any rain yet so I can't comment on how much rain protection it offers.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Rackley

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: I put these up over our driveway, also one on our back deck. The driveway ones protect our cars from the sap and the pinecones the squirrels throw down.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Quick, cheap way to provide some shade.
customer_reviews.text: Only had this a few weeks, but it gets the job done for a temporary shade until we built a patio cover in a few years. Note that these shade sails tend to bow in on the edges and with their installed height, typically don't shade and area as big as their "footprint." Take home: g.o as big as you can afford in your space.
customer_reviews.author: cliffchic

customer_reviews.title: So glad I found this sail!
customer_reviews.text: Searched for awhile to find a larger shade sail in a unique color. I’m very happy; this is a quality product at a good price in a perfect color for my patio. I did buy the hardware kit to install it. Quick delivery, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Returning Item
customer_reviews.text: After installing this I realized that the sun needed to be blocked straight along the 12x12 edge. If you look at the picture, you can see that the canopy indents quite a bit. I ended up with a rectangle canopy instead. Had it blocked the sun, it would of been perfect. This is a real good quality canopy.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn B.

customer_reviews.title: Add Spark to your settings
customer_reviews.text: Great way to add color and block sun. We added it to a unique area in our yard.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: the larger ones are better for shade
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 sizes, unsure of what I would need. Definitely go larger. The 12x12x17 was too small for my space. It went up fairly easy once I figured out my 3 points. You will need to buy better rope and something to cinch it up with on at least 2 sides. I plan to leave it up, so we'll see how long it lasts in the Florida sun. I like the product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen S

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Provides great shade for our driveway. It seems to be very well made, heavy duty with good reinforced stitching. I didn't want to use rope or turnbuckles to install it so I went to Harbor Freight and got some strap binders which worked great to install it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Mcmahon

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I liked it so much that I bought two more. The colors work well together; I got compliments from my neighbor. Using two small and one large. Perfect for shade, and keeping litter from neighbor’s trees from raining on my patio.
customer_reviews.author: Danny E

customer_reviews.title: Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to buy things online sometimes. You take a chance and hope it’s good quality. Well, this shade is good quality and a good price! It looks fantastic! I have only had it up for about a month but, it has made it thru several bad storms already!
customer_reviews.author: critter

customer_reviews.title: Far too tapered
customer_reviews.text: This is the g string of shade sails: technically there but not offering much coverage. The sale is very tapered and even though I measured out a triangular area to the dimensions of the sail, it does not cover the area needed and will not cover a table and chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Springs springs springs!!!
customer_reviews.text: The sail itself is well made, the only issue is this unit is not right angle therefore part of the mounting had to be placed inside the car port. My suggestion is use high quality springs on all corners and that will help in overcoming severe weather. We had a rainstorm yesterday and the sail held like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Mjuaji

customer_reviews.title: Don’t melt!  These shades are well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome alternative to umbrellas that tear up in the wind! Installed this to shade an employee outdoor break area.... it’s been a huge hit for the staff! Great quality, well made - for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Nice Canopy
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the canopy is great, the only issue I had was stretching it tight enough that it did not droop. It has survived the wind and the rain the past few weeks. I haven't noticed any fading from the sun. We are using it to create shade in the yard for the Dogs when they are outside.
customer_reviews.author: JomommaG

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job of shading vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it to shade my new vehicle and to keep leaves, pine needles and sap off it. Does a great job. Car stays cooler even in the Florida sun. Liked it so much we have ordered a second one so as to be able to cover both our vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Yoyi

customer_reviews.title: Nice sail, cool color
customer_reviews.text: Nice large shade sail, suited our purposes. Currently have over the pool deck but may reposition to hang over the pool itself at some point. Need to put in some tall posts so that it hangs high enough.
customer_reviews.author: Brant

customer_reviews.title: Almost a year and looks brand new!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for patio shade. Attached to "Hardy Board" Soffit of hose a all three points. It has survived buckets of rain and squall gusts without tearing or pulling out of the soffit. Now I'm constructing a 14'x14' arbor and need a matching cover. I will definitely buy from this supplier if he can provide one.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Roseman

customer_reviews.title: Green one is great!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for what we were looking for. I got the green and blue. The blue one wasn't great it reminded me of a tarp. But the two green ones worked out amazing.
customer_reviews.author: JB33

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to our patio.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two right triangular shades from this vendor and they look great! They will help provide much needed shade in our patio this summer. You have to find just the right placement for a snug fit but not too difficult to do. (Note that on the picture, the two outer larger triangles are the ones purchased from LyShade, the smaller triangle in the center was purchased from another Amazon vendor)
customer_reviews.author: Glenda E.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product for shade
customer_reviews.text: After years of losing umbrella's to the wind, we decided to try the sail to cover an area by our pool. It has survived a few winds so far it is still holding on and offers shade in a necessary part of our home.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I installed this last week. So far so good. I used red paracord I bought from Home Depot instead of what came with shade sail. The product itself is well built, though only time will tell. I wish it was a bit larger to provide more shade. I’m planning on buying another one but much larger.
customer_reviews.author: J. C

customer_reviews.title: Temperature drop was impressive
customer_reviews.text: This summer has been brutal in my South Texas region so my gardenias were dying. I bought this sail as a last resort and am very happy I did. The triangle let me place it to where my plants get the morning sun and block the searing afternoon sun rays. Very reasonable price as an add on.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up.
customer_reviews.text: It went up amazingly easy. Haven’t had it through the rain yet. We bought the hanging kit and we’re lucky not to have to use any rope. It is perfect for the space and love the color. We’ll see how it survives the SWFL sun and heat.
customer_reviews.author: starartstartart

customer_reviews.title: It's not going to work
customer_reviews.text: It does not hang right. We could not pull this in any combination of directions to make it tight when hung. We will not be able to use it. The coverage area is very small because of the way it is cut.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy for this 69 year old lady to install alone, but I did it, and I love the outcome!
customer_reviews.text: I did it alone so there's that! I love the shade and the colors (gray and musty blue) are calm and nice. We get wind here a lot and they are fine! Great idea, glad I bought them. Rain gets through a bit but it's fine and expected. Just enough light, too.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Go Sailing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!!! It fits our backyard perfectly. It covers our back yard table when the sun is blazing down. I read from another review, instead of using the rope to use a ratchet tiedown too tighten the sail.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie N.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up, aesthetically pleasing, i had to use two shades to get desired cover, but for the price i believe its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: km

customer_reviews.title: Not great coverage
customer_reviews.text: It's not tightly sewn. You can see through it so it doesn't do a good job of protecting you from the sun. It feels like a potato sack. That plasticky feeling. More curved that what I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne

customer_reviews.title: Still new, but appears strong and very durable. ...
customer_reviews.text: Still new, but appears strong and very durable. Stretched it very tight and it held well with quality appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Robert S. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Great for shade
customer_reviews.text: I hung this Lyshade to provide shade over my deck. Even though it has only been up for a week, so far it has endured 2 heavy rains and lots of wind. Over time the color may fade or the material may not last but I love the way it looks now.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Get one !
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a long but narrow deck off the back patio, fits perfectly and looks great have gotten lots of compliments from my guests. Choose your color wisely to compliment or match the surroundings.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Size is wrong
customer_reviews.text: It is not 12’x12’x17’. It is barely 11’x11’. If it is measured by tracing the curve, that is very misleading and measured incorrectly. I haven’t had it long enough for overall durability so time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Torrey J.

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Can’t seem to get it stretched out, one end always hanging down no matter how tight I make it
customer_reviews.author: Fay Martin

customer_reviews.title: NOT A RIGHT TRIANGLE AT ALL!
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. Not a right triangle. Wavy edges even when taught. Will not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect just wish I would have purchased a larger one
customer_reviews.text: So far it has held up to the elements no tearing Or fading. Mine is stretching because I have it over the top of a duck enclosure and the new ducks like to sleep on top of it. It is able to move with the wind as well as have water drain so it should last quite a while
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Works and Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: This sail looked awesome once we got it positioned with another shade! Provided great shade; but, the area we were trying to cover was too large and the wind was too much for the posts to stand. The sail was strong and withstood the strong wind; but, the posts bent over making it sag.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki O

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: I've just recently purchased this, however, I've previously purchased three identical shades and had them installed in my pool area since the summer of 2018 in southern California. They've been subjected to wind, rain and the extreme sun and are holding up very well. Overall would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: don cottrell

customer_reviews.title: Cool shaped and colored shade over the pool? Yes, please!
customer_reviews.text: It was big and awkward to install but it’s a big shade. Great color, the bright green looks great over my pool. Not water resistant but that’s okay. It’s like woven plastic but I feel like that will help it’s durability. All in all I like it!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Made in the shade
customer_reviews.text: Good construction, helpful hardware, relatively easy to install as long as you can identify three sturdy anchor points. I used a sturdy oak tree for one of mine. Love the shade!
customer_reviews.author: Zenophile

customer_reviews.title: Nice shade
customer_reviews.text: This right triangle shade worked perfect for the corner of my roof. I had the sun coming in through my slider in the late afternoon and was unable to sit at the computer to work. Now I have the sun shade up and it is a lot cooler and no sun directly on me.
customer_reviews.author: Bev W

customer_reviews.title: very happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.text: we have been able to enjoy our backyard so much more since the arrival and installation of our shade! We chose it originally as it was the right color and size for our yard but we didn't expect it to look so lovely in person. Just the right amount of light to be blocked by and shine through the slightly shimmery threads!! We've also gone through a heavy rainstorm and it held up great. I've already recommended it to several others who were looking for solutions in their own backyards. The fabric and seems are durable and we expect continued enjoyment from our purchase and increased usability of our outdoor space!
customer_reviews.author: Clare Spartz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We installed the 16.5’ x 16.5’ x 22’ Shade in Cadet Blue (dark gray) over a portion of our Swimming Hole in thr Texas Hill Country. It looks like a custom-made shade, very stylish. Installation was easy and it looks great! We may order a second one to give us additional coverage. We recommend this shade and the Lyshade company. It’s a more economical option than a large umbrella, and withstands the gusts of wind better than an umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell J. Kirksey

customer_reviews.title: Odd Shape
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the fabric seemed OK but the dimensions are so odd. The shade is really long and skinny making it impossible to get really tight. The sides will be droopy and the actual area being shaded gets really small because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya McLean

customer_reviews.title: Good canopy but small
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than I thought it would be. It’s up but too small to provide much shade. It’s well built and I have no complaints about quality. Just make sure this size is right for you.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

product_meta.title: LyShade 16'5" x 16'5" x 22'11" Right Triangle Sun Shade Sail Canopy (Terracotta) - UV Block for Patio and Outdoor
product_meta.description:
Size:16'5" X 16'5" X 22'11"| Color:Terracotta

Our Sun Shade Sails are made of tightly weaved HDPE fabric with a UV filter that not only prevents up to 90-95% of the damaging UV rays but also is water-repellent. It creates pleasure for your garden, pool or any outdoor living space!

High Quality
LyShade delivers quality one can trust. We use high quality knitted fabric to provide sails. About installations we provide fasteners with quality of AISI 316, which is the highest quality level of stainless steel available on the market.

Easy to Install & Wash
Shade Sails are wonderfully versatile: they can be attached to homes, trees, or patio columns. In addition, they can be supported by wood posts or steel columns embedded in concrete footings. You can take down sails as required and easily clean them with just soap and water.


Remind: The hardware kit is NOT included in the package. If you need it, please refer to the set product.
feature_bullets: Long-lasting, knitted polyethylene allows rain to pass through so water will not collect or pool
Advanced engineered fabric prevents 90-95% of harmful UV rays though it is breathable allowing air to circulate
Reinforced, stitched corners with steel fittings attach quick and easy to mounting points
Easy to attach and take down in a few minutes

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,122 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
